meanings.definition: A person who studies language and literature.
meanings.sent1: Many philologists enjoy reading old books and analyzing ancient texts.
meanings.sent2: The philologists at the university are researching the origins of different languages.
meanings.sent3: The group of philologists had a lively discussion about the meaning of a rare word in a poem.
meanings.sent4: She dove into the text like a skilled philologist, uncovering hidden meanings and connections.
meanings.sent5: The philologists' passion for language and literature is truly inspiring.

meanings.definition: Experts in the history and development of languages.
meanings.sent1: The philologists presented their findings on the evolution of the English language.
meanings.sent2: As philologists, they have dedicated their lives to understanding how languages change over time.
meanings.sent3: The philologists were so engrossed in their research that they lost track of time.
meanings.sent4: His knowledge of languages was so vast, he was like a walking encyclopedia to his fellow philologists.
meanings.sent5: The philologists' expertise in language history is unmatched.

meanings.definition: Those who analyze written texts for historical and cultural significance.
meanings.sent1: The philologists meticulously examined the ancient manuscript for clues about the past.
meanings.sent2: In their role as philologists, they deciphered the hidden meanings in the text.
meanings.sent3: The philologists were so absorbed in their work that they didn't notice the time passing.
meanings.sent4: She approached the document like a detective, with the keen eye of a philologist.
meanings.sent5: The philologists' ability to uncover the secrets of the past is truly remarkable.
